Name: The Lady Wears Red
Ingredients: 45 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
7.5 ml Grand Marnier or other cognac orange liqueur
7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: SHAKE all ingredients with ice and fine strain into chilled glass. FLOAT champagne foam made by macerating orange zests in champagne overnight, adding gelatin and charging with N2O siphon.
Review: This 'Lady' is high maintenance but she delivers a complex reward.
History: Adapted from a drink created in 2008 by Ben Carlotto at The Voodoo Rooms, Edinburgh, Scotland. The original recipe calls for homemade dry orange syrup made by macerating orange zests in a blend of different sugars with Lillet Blanc and fino sherry. It also calls for homemade citrus bitters, a complex mixture of kaffir lime leaves, various citrus elements, and spices like cardamom and cassia.
Nutrition: One serving of The Lady Wears Red contains 218 calories
